description: Estimated yearly expenditure on routine preventive maintenance tasks such as calibration, cleaning and safety checks.
prompt: Provide the typical annual preventive‑maintenance cost, in USD per year, for this specific instrument model. Quote recent manufacturer price guides, third‑party service contracts or industry averages published after 2022. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: What does this cost include?
FAQs.answer: It covers scheduled maintenance visits, basic consumables, and calibration certificates.

FAQs.question: Is labor included?
FAQs.answer: Yes—labor for the preventive visit is generally part of the quoted sum.

FAQs.question: Can I reduce this cost?
FAQs.answer: Signing a multi‑year contract or bundling multiple instruments often lowers the rate.

FAQs.question: Does heavy use increase the cost?
FAQs.answer: Yes, units in 24‑hour operation may require extra service visits.

FAQs.question: Are spare parts included?
FAQs.answer: Only inexpensive consumables; major parts are billed separately.

FAQs.question: Is the figure inflation‑adjusted?
FAQs.answer: Figures should be reported in current‑year USD values.

description: Average cost for small, non‑critical repairs such as replacing fuses, knobs, or minor seals.
prompt: State the usual price range, in USD, for minor repair events on this model—parts plus labor. Use service‑provider invoices or manufacturer sources from 2022‑2025. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: What qualifies as a minor repair?
FAQs.answer: Repairs that do not require disassembling major subsystems and cost under USD 1000.

FAQs.question: Are diagnostics billed separately?
FAQs.answer: Diagnostics are usually folded into the minor‑repair flat rate.

FAQs.question: Is there warranty coverage?
FAQs.answer: Warranty typically covers the first 12 months for manufacturer defects.

FAQs.question: Typical turnaround time?
FAQs.answer: Often completed within one on‑site visit (2‑3 hours).

FAQs.question: Are OEM parts mandatory?
FAQs.answer: Using OEM parts preserves the warranty but increases cost ~10‑20 %.

FAQs.question: Can I perform it myself?
FAQs.answer: User‑performed minor fixes are possible but may void warranty.

description: Estimated cost for large‑scale repairs such as motor or compressor replacement.
prompt: Report the expected cost, in USD, for a typical major repair on this instrument (e.g., motor or compressor swap). Reference OEM parts catalogs and authorized‑service quotes from 2023‑2025. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: What counts as a major repair?
FAQs.answer: Any repair involving core subsystems costing over USD 1000.

FAQs.question: Is loaner equipment provided?
FAQs.answer: Some OEMs offer rental units at extra charge.

FAQs.question: Lead time for parts?
FAQs.answer: Critical parts generally ship within 7‑10 days from regional hubs.

FAQs.question: Warranty on the repair?
FAQs.answer: Major repairs usually carry a 3‑ to 6‑month parts & labor warranty.

FAQs.question: Can third‑party parts be used?
FAQs.answer: Yes, but compatibility and certification must be verified.

description: Length of the standard factory warranty supplied at purchase.
prompt: List the default factory warranty duration in months for new units sold in North America. Use official datasheets dated 2023‑2025. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: What does the warranty cover?
FAQs.answer: Defects in materials and workmanship, excluding consumables.

FAQs.question: Does it include on‑site labor?
FAQs.answer: Most OEM warranties include labor for warranty repairs.

FAQs.question: Is calibration covered?
FAQs.answer: Initial factory calibration is covered; routine recalibration is not.

FAQs.question: How to extend coverage?
FAQs.answer: Purchase an extended‑warranty plan within 90 days of delivery.

FAQs.question: Is warranty transferable?
FAQs.answer: Yes, upon written notification to the OEM.

FAQs.question: Are shipping costs covered?
FAQs.answer: Inbound shipping is covered; outbound may be the owner’s responsibility.

description: Price charged to lengthen warranty beyond the standard term.
prompt: Specify the additional cost, in USD, for a one‑year OEM extended warranty purchased at the time of sale. Include prices valid after 2023. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Does it cover spare parts?
FAQs.answer: Yes—OEM parts are covered during the extended period.

FAQs.question: Can it be bought later?
FAQs.answer: Usually within the original warranty window for a surcharge.

level3: Average Spare Parts Cost per Year
description: Typical annual expenditure on consumable or wear items outside scheduled service contracts.
prompt: Estimate the yearly spend, in USD, on consumable spare parts (seals, brushes) for this model, assuming normal lab usage. Cite purchase records from 2022‑2025. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: How does usage affect cost?
FAQs.answer: Higher duty cycles increase wear and thus costs.

FAQs.question: Is shipping included?
FAQs.answer: Yes—standard ground shipping to continental US.

FAQs.question: Are bulk discounts available?
FAQs.answer: Yes—OEMs offer 5‑10 % off for multi‑pack orders.

FAQs.question: Are taxes included?
FAQs.answer: Quotes should be exclusive of local taxes unless stated.

description: Recommended number of operating hours between scheduled service events.
prompt: Provide the OEM‑recommended service interval in operating hours. Use the latest service manuals (2023‑2025). give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Can interval be extended?
FAQs.answer: In low‑duty environments, OEM may approve extension after oil analysis.

FAQs.question: Indicator for service?
FAQs.answer: Controller displays a wrench icon and logs hours.

FAQs.question: Reset procedure?
FAQs.answer: Reset via service menu after maintenance completion.

FAQs.question: Warranty impact if skipped?
FAQs.answer: Skipping service can void warranty coverage.

description: Average labor hours required to diagnose and complete a repair once initiated.
prompt: State the MTTR, in hours, for typical in‑field repairs. Source field‑service statistics from 2022‑2025. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Does MTTR include part shipping?
FAQs.answer: No—clock starts when technician begins work on site.

FAQs.question: How is MTTR calculated?
FAQs.answer: Average of documented repair durations over a 3‑year period.

FAQs.question: Factors affecting MTTR?
FAQs.answer: Technician skill, parts availability, site access.

FAQs.question: Benchmark vs industry?
FAQs.answer: Unit MTTR is ~15 % below average for comparable centrifuges.

FAQs.question: Can MTTR be improved?
FAQs.answer: Stocking critical parts on site lowers time significantly.

FAQs.question: Does remote diagnostics help?
FAQs.answer: Yes—pre‑call troubleshooting cuts 0.5 h on average.

description: Hourly rate charged by OEM‑certified technicians for out‑of‑contract service.
prompt: Provide the typical OEM service labor rate in USD per hour for North American customers, current as of 2025. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Is travel included?
FAQs.answer: Travel time is often billed at 50 % of the rate.

FAQs.question: Currency adjustments?
FAQs.answer: Rates are reviewed annually based on CPI.

FAQs.question: Remote support fee?
FAQs.answer: Remote troubleshooting may be billed at half rate.

description: Estimated financial impact per calendar day the equipment is non‑operational.
prompt: Estimate the average revenue or productivity loss, in USD per day, incurred when this instrument is down. Supply industry benchmarks or customer case studies. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: How is this calculated?
FAQs.answer: Lost billable assays + labor idle time + opportunity cost.

FAQs.question: Insurance coverage?
FAQs.answer: Some policies cover lost revenue after 48 hours downtime.

FAQs.question: Mitigation strategies?
FAQs.answer: Maintain backup units or service agreements with rapid response.

FAQs.question: Tax implications?
FAQs.answer: Losses may be deductible as business interruption.

FAQs.question: Can OEM compensate?
FAQs.answer: Only if downtime is due to warranty‑covered failure.

description: Typical price for a standard 24‑place fixed‑angle rotor compatible with the instrument.
prompt: Provide the list price, in USD, to purchase a replacement fixed‑angle rotor for this model. Use 2024‑2025 OEM catalogs or distributor quotes. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Includes rotor lid?
FAQs.answer: Yes, complete rotor assembly with lid.

FAQs.question: Is balance verification included?
FAQs.answer: Sold separately as a certification service.

FAQs.question: Lead time?
FAQs.answer: Typically 2‑6 weeks if not in local stock.

FAQs.question: Discount for trade‑in?
FAQs.answer: Some OEMs offer 10 % credit for old rotors.

FAQs.question: Alternate compatible rotors?
FAQs.answer: Third‑party rotors exist but may void warranty.

description: Cost for a full set of swing‑bucket adapters (usually 4 adapters).
prompt: State the OEM list price, in USD, for a complete swing‑bucket adapter set for this centrifuge as of 2025. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Sold individually?
FAQs.answer: Yes, but buying the set is ~15 % cheaper.

description: Price to replace the centrifugal‑chamber lid seal/gasket.
prompt: Provide the OEM price, in USD, for a replacement lid gasket for the centrifuge. Use 2024‑2025 price lists. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Recommended replacement interval?
FAQs.answer: Every 18‑24 months or upon visible wear.

description: Replacement price for the centrifuge drive‑motor assembly.
prompt: Provide the list price, in USD, for a new OEM drive motor for this model. Reference 2023‑2025 parts catalogs. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Does it include bearings?
FAQs.answer: Yes—motor comes pre‑assembled with sealed bearings.

FAQs.question: Core exchange program?
FAQs.answer: Discounted price if old motor returned.

description: Price to replace the primary PCB (control electronics).
prompt: State the OEM price, in USD, for the main control PCB for this centrifuge (2024‑2025 edition). give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Is firmware pre‑loaded?
FAQs.answer: Yes, with the latest stable release.

FAQs.question: Calibration after swap?
FAQs.answer: A full system calibration is required.

FAQs.question: Return of faulty board required?
FAQs.answer: Yes, for rebate against new part.

FAQs.question: Static‑safe packaging?
FAQs.answer: Ships in ESD‑safe bag and foam box.

description: Cost to replace the LCD or touch‑screen display module.
prompt: Quote the OEM price, in USD, for the complete display/touch‑screen module for this centrifuge. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Firmware compatibility?
FAQs.answer: Compatible with firmware v3.1 and higher.

description: Price for a replacement locking rotor lid or cap.
prompt: Provide the cost, in USD, for a replacement rotor lid compatible with the standard fixed‑angle rotor. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Interchangeable with swing‑bucket rotors?
FAQs.answer: No—each rotor type has a unique lid.

description: Cost for a full set of replacement O‑rings and gaskets for lid and rotor interfaces.
prompt: Quote the OEM price, in USD, for a complete gasket/O‑ring kit for this model (2025 pricing). give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Kit contents?
FAQs.answer: Two lid seals, one rotor seal, lubricant sachet.

description: Price for a complete rotor‑shaft bearing replacement kit.
prompt: Provide the OEM list price, in USD, for the rotor‑shaft bearing kit (includes upper and lower bearings). give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

description: Cost to replace primary and secondary drive belts.
prompt: State the price, in USD, for the OEM belt set (primary + secondary) for this centrifuge. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

description: Price for replacement of the safety door‑latch mechanism.
prompt: Provide the OEM price, in USD, for the complete door‑latch assembly for this centrifuge model. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Common failure mode?
FAQs.answer: Wear on the striker pin after ~50 000 cycles.

description: Replacement price for the refrigeration compressor unit.
prompt: Quote the OEM list price, in USD, for the refrigeration compressor assembly (including dryer filter) for this refrigerated centrifuge. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Installation requires EPA certification?
FAQs.answer: Yes—technician must hold Section 608 Type I or higher.

FAQs.question: Compressor brand?
FAQs.answer: Embraco or Secop, depending on batch.

FAQs.question: Return of old compressor?
FAQs.answer: OEM arranges disposal as hazardous waste.

description: Cost to replace the internal electronics‑cooling fan.
prompt: Provide the OEM price, in USD, for the main cooling/ventilation fan unit. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

FAQs.question: Can I use third‑party fan?
FAQs.answer: Yes, if voltage and airflow match OEM spec.

description: Price for the AC‑to‑DC main power‑supply module.
prompt: State the OEM price, in USD, for the main PSU module for this centrifuge model. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

description: Cost to replace the chamber temperature probe or sensor.
prompt: Provide the OEM list price, in USD, for the chamber temperature sensor (NTC/PT100) for this centrifuge. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this

description: Price for a complete set of anti‑vibration feet/dampers.
prompt: Quote the OEM price, in USD, for the set of four vibration dampers/feet for this centrifuge. give the answer in JSON format and create a json file of all of this
